channel.title: Cant get my server online
channel.description:
Im using the uTorrent method, since I dont have my modem's password.
On a different computer, it worked. Now I am on a personal laptop, with Vista. It does NOT work.
Whats wrong? I enabled the port via Windows Firewall also.
EDIT/UPDATE/W/E - I transferred my source files to the computer I previously used, and ran the server. This time, ITS ONLINE!
So, it has to be a setting on my laptop preventing me, correct?
EDIT2 - What the hell! google said the server was online. Yet my laptop cannot connect to:
My IP My LAN IP My server no-ip 127.0.0.1
What the hell?
Also, on the computer I run the source on, it can ONLY connect to 127.0.0.1..

item.title: Cant get my server online
item.dc:creator: @Brenz Brenz
item.description:
@Brenz wrote:

Obviously Portforwarding is the best way but if they cant do it then uTorrent is the way.

And using a neighbours internet connection would be terrible. Why ?

  1. They may not have wireless

  2. If they do have wireless the Chances are they have a WEP Key.

  3. The signal would be very poor causing more lag on the server.

  4. Wireless is slow anyway and can be very tempermental around other mobile devices.

Brendan

Read full topic

item.title: Cant get my server online
item.dc:creator: @d10n d10n
item.description:
@d10n wrote:

i’ve read the thread, but im just saying that the uTorrent method doesn’t mean 100% success. hope you knew that
only way to ensure it works is portforward.
and you could always try to steal internet access from neighbours. if you have luck they’ve forwarded it,
(low chance though)

Read full topic

item.title: Cant get my server online
item.dc:creator: @Brenz Brenz
item.description:
@Brenz wrote:

d1on if u read the thread you would know that the uTorrent method means that you dont have to portforward and that he has had the server showing online on a server status.

Thanks Dude i appreciate it.

Brendan

Read full topic

item.title: Cant get my server online
item.dc:creator: @d10n d10n
item.description:
@d10n wrote:

you could even keep the thing closed, the windows firewall doesn’t matter
the problem is that the router won’t allow port 43594 TCP to connect.
or try to scan for a different router and hope for luck. OR try to use these as pass, and user
account: admin
pass: default

good luck

Read full topic

item.title: Cant get my server online
item.dc:creator: @Brenz Brenz
item.description:
@Brenz wrote:

When on a LAN machine you CAN’T use your IP or No-ip only the localhost connection or your IPv4 address.

Brendan

Read full topic

item.title: Cant get my server online
item.dc:creator: @MoparScaperDude MoparScaperDude
item.description:
@MoparScaperDude wrote:

Brenz, I dont know what happened, but all of a sudden, R-L says I am online. I am not trying to advertise or anything, but could you try to connect to it?

The only reason I ask is because RL says its up, yet the only was I can connect is via 127.0.0.1

Read full topic

item.title: Cant get my server online
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

I know its not harder to work with. Its just horrible. Its a power hog, a memory hog, and like i said, conflicts with nearly everything (even itself half the time…). I suggest that anyone who has winblows downloads and installs ubuntu.

item.title: Cant get my server online
item.dc:creator: @Brenz Brenz
item.description:
@Brenz wrote:

Try connecting via localhost

@ m.dog tbh Vista isnt any harder to work with than XP or any other OS, i ran my server easily with Vista.

Brendan

Read full topic

item.title: Cant get my server online
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Vista conflicts with everything. Thats probably why. My suggestion, get rid of vista and install Ubuntu or some good form of linux (usually free). Or buy a mac.
